metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8378 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In KeePassX before 0.4.4, a cleartext copy of password data is created upon a cancel of an XML export action. This allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading the .xml dotfile.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keepassx - 0.4.3+dfsg-0.1ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: keepassx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.3+dfsg-0.1ubuntu1.14.04.1').
